meanings.sent1: Her grandmother predeceased her, leaving her with fond memories.
meanings.sent2: He predeceased his wife by a few years.
meanings.sent3: The cat predeceased the mouse in the race to the cheese.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun seemed to predecease the darkness of night.
meanings.sent5: The falling leaves predeceased the arrival of winter.

meanings.definition: To pass away before another person.
meanings.sent1: The elderly couple had an agreement to predecease each other.
meanings.sent2: She predeceased her twin brother, causing great sorrow.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner jokingly said he would predecease his competitors.
meanings.sent4: The early bird tends to predecease the late risers.
meanings.sent5: The melting snow predeceased the blooming flowers in spring.

meanings.sent1: The ancient king predeceased all his heirs, leading to a succession crisis.
meanings.sent2: The family dog predeceased the birth of their first child.
meanings.sent3: The old tree seemed to predecease the new saplings around it.
meanings.sent4: The fading light predeceased the arrival of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The falling star predeceased the wish made upon it.
